event: First known inhabitants are the Arawak and Taíno peoples from South America.
Christopher Columbus visits Jamaica on his second voyage to the Americas.
Spanish colonization begins; enslaved Africans brought to replace declining indigenous population.
British forces capture Jamaica from the Spanish.
Treaty of Madrid confirms British possession of Jamaica.
Port Royal, a major pirate haven, is destroyed by a massive earthquake.
Baptist War (Christmas Rebellion) led by Samuel Sharpe, a major slave uprising.
Slavery abolished throughout the British Empire; full emancipation by 1838.
Morant Bay Rebellion leads to direct British colonial rule.
New constitution grants universal adult suffrage.
Jamaica joins the West Indies Federation.
Jamaica gains full independence from the United Kingdom on August 6.
Michael Manley becomes Prime Minister, pursuing democratic socialism.
Political violence intensifies during election; Edward Seaga becomes Prime Minister.
P. J. Patterson becomes Jamaica’s first Black Prime Minister.
Economic reforms and IMF agreement signed during global financial crisis.
State of emergency declared amid manhunt for drug lord Christopher 'Dudus' Coke.
Andrew Holness elected Prime Minister, initiating new economic growth policies.
